markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 22"
    pfs=""
>
[Shadowed Scale, the Jungle Secret](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1530)
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Strength of Thousands</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Unique" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=161" />
<trait label="Artifact" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=253" />
<trait label="Conjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=33" />
<trait label="Invested" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=98" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
<trait label="Primal" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=134" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #174: Shadows of the Ancients](/Sources.aspx?ID=115) pg. 77</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** worn mask

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This gold-inlaid wooden mask depicts the reptilian visage of a [mokele-mbembe](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1230), a jungle predator seen by the Mwangi as embodiments of nature's strength and majesty. If you're a Magaambyan who already has a mask, you can use _Shadowed Scale, the Jungle Secret_ in lieu of your own mask for the purposes of mask-related abilities, such as [Magic Warrior Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=903). When you wear the mask, you are always [concealed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=4) while in a jungle.

<document level="2" id="action-1149" />

<document level="2" id="action-1150" />

**Destruction** If the progenitor of all mokele-mbembes stomps on the mask, it is crushed to splinters.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Shadowed Scale, the Jungle Secret
